title: Courgette & Green beans Bulgur wheat with Lean beef mince
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Toss courgette and green beans with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season lean beef mince and place on the tray. Roast for 36 min, turning once.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Lean for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Pakistani Protein Egg Bites with Mushrooms
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Season black beans and place on the tray. Roast for 28 min, turning once.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Italian Tofu (firm) with Whole-wheat pasta & Carrots
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss carrots and cabbage with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 31 min, turning once.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tempeh and Cabbage Airfry
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 200°C.
Toss cabbage and asparagus with half the butter, salt, pepper and cajun blend; spread on a tray.
Season tempeh and place on the tray. Air-fry for 39 min, turning once.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Broccoli & Carrots Polenta with Tofu (firm)
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tofu (firm) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and carrots with ras el hanout 3 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the polenta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Polenta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Prawns Thai green curry paste bowl
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss cherry tomatoes and mushrooms with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 30 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Tortilla wrap or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tofu (firm) and Mushrooms Roast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss mushrooms and kale with half the butter, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 36 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Garlic & Peas Spaghetti with Chicken breast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss garlic and peas with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season chicken breast and place on the tray. Roast for 38 min, turning once.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
